wiki/Patterns.html.title: Overview about typical used patterns | BVMS UI Automation
wiki/Patterns.html.keywords: Overview about typical used patterns GOF Pattern Template Method In class libraries with similar sibling classes the Template Method pattern is often seen. It allows to define in the parent class a common overall logic, where the individual steps could be adjusted regarding the needs in the derived classes. In the sample AddDevice is the Template Method which defines three steps. The middle step AddDeviceCore should allow the derived classes to implement its own logic. So this step can be defined as abstract or virtual to allow overriding. public class ParentClass { ... public void AddDevice(IDevice device) { DoSomethingBefore(); AddDeviceCore(device); DoSomethingAfter(); } protected abstract void AddDeviceCore(IDevice device); ... In the subclass now AddDeviceCore needs to be implemented. public class ParentClass { ... protected override void AddDeviceCore(IDevice device) { DecoderType.Value = device.DecoderName; ... } ... One other thing is to remark here. In the typical case, that only one step needs to be adjusted, the overridable method is named like the calling method with the suffic Core .

wiki/Good_to_know.html.title: Good to know | BVMS UI Automation
wiki/Good_to_know.html.keywords: Good to know XUnit Categories, Trait To group unit test in a way which makes sense for a project, the Attribute Trait is used. The following example puts the test method Can_Start_App under the category UI-Basics . [Theory, Trait("Category", "UI-Basics")] [InlineData(false)] public void Can_Start_App(bool closeAppAfterRun) ReSharper 's Unit Test Explorer ( Extensions > ReSharper > Windows > Unit Tests or Ctrl + Alt + U ) shows the method then under category UI-Basics and belonging class: InlineData and MemberData XUnit allows the definition of multiple input values for a test. Such parametrizable tests needs to have the attribute Theory . Test without parameters are setup as Fact . With InlineData the parameters of the text method are filled with the corresponding data of the InlineData definition: [Theory] [InlineData("1.1.1.1", DecoderType.BarcoMonitorWall)] [InlineData("223.255.255.255", DecoderType.VideoJetDecoder7000)] public void Can_add_and_configure_decoder_device(string deviceName, DecoderType decoderType) With MemberData it is possible to extract the test-data provider for better readability: [Theory] [MemberData(nameof(Data))] public void Can_switch_Panes(PaneTypeWithPaneName paneTypeWithPaneName) { ... public static IEnumerable<object[]> Data => new List<object[]> { new object[] { new PaneTypeWithPaneName(...) }, new object[] { new PaneTypeWithPaneName(...) }, ...

wiki/Architecture.html.title: Architecture Overview | BVMS UI Automation
wiki/Architecture.html.keywords: Architecture Overview Main Classes Devices All devices have one common property - that is the name of the device. Depending on the device type a device is listed in the DeviceTree on the left side or a pane on the right side. All devices are derives from IDevice and Device . DeviceManager To add and/or configure a device it is necessary to know how the device needs to be added. Some devices are added by using a context sensitive menu at the device type node in the tree others are added via button in the pane. A DeviceManager is responisible to handle that logic for a specific device. That means, each device needs a corresponding and individual DeviceManager. All these DeviceManagers are subclasses of DeviceManager . AddDeviceDialog During adding a device, most devices need some details specified via a dialog. These dialogs are subclasses of a class generic AddDeviceDialog<T> where T : IDevice . All devices with needs further details captured via a dialog, should derive from AddDeviceDialog<T> and implement the necessary individual logic.

wiki/Documentation.html.title: Documentation | BVMS UI Automation
wiki/Documentation.html.keywords: Documentation Introduction The documentation for the BVMS UI Automation project is provided in a modern and state of the art model. It is based on these sources and perspectives: XML Comments this is the in-source XML-based code documentation with triple slash ( /// <summary>...</summary> ). Wiki which is hosted on Auzure DevOps and based on MarkDown as the markup language and Git as the storage to interact with. It is located here: Wiki for BVMS UI Automation To keep the documentation parts as most as possible together we use the technique of Git sub-modules. Git sub-modules allow a Git ("main") repository to reference other ("sub") repositories. This gives the possibility to divide a project into several containers (e.g. because of different life cycle or usage needs) but bundle them together at a top level. In our concrete case we had to include two Git sub-modules BVMS UI Automation project Wiki this Wiki is a Git repository itself containing the MarkDown wiki pages DocFX based Online documentation GitHub Pages allow easily to host (static) web sites. These web sites have to be provided in a (dedicated) Git repository. So the output of DocFX (the static web sites) are committed to this Git repository and then pushed to the remote ( github.io ). Advice: To clone a Git repository together with its sub-modules use the option --recursive Folder structure The DevTree's doc -folder contains the project`s documentation itself and the configuration files for DocFX to process the content. The content and intention in detail: folder doc itself artifacts to configure the DocFX documentation system docfx-json the DocFX project file toc.yml the table of content file to hook up the wiki-pages index.md the landing page for the DocFX generated online documentation sub-folder wiki this is the repository of the Git sub-module from BVMS UI Automation project Wiki it was included via Git's submodule subcommand git submodule add git@ssh.dev.azure.com:v3/<organization>/<project>/<repository>.wiki doc/wiki sub-folder sdk contains the metadata for the SDK part of the documentation extracted from projects ConfigClient.DomainModel and ConfigClient.Sdk sub-folder api contains the metadata for the API part of the documentation extracted from projects ConfigClient.Api and ConfigClient.ConsoleApp sub-folder sdk-api artifacts to configure the DocFX documentation system merges content based on SDK and API metadate together sub-folder _site this is the repository of the Git sub-module with the static web-sites as an output of DocFX the repository is connected to the web site hosting plattform (e.g. github.io as a remote) git submodule add git@<alias>:<username>/<username>.github.io.git doc/_site DocFX To process the content of these sources we use DocFX which is the successor of SHFB (Sandcastle Help File Builder). DocFX is platform-agnostic and runs perfectly also under .NET Core. DocFX creates static web-sites which can easily hosted somewhere. To update the documenation whese steps are essential: Update the worktree to the latest stand of the Wiki content Extract the XML metadata of the source code (the XML comment) with DocFX Process the documentation input with DocFX to create static web sites as output Commit the output of DocFX to the "online documentation" repository connected to hoster Push this "online documentation" repository Update the worktree Open Git Bash in/with sub-folder wiki Run command git fetch to get the latest stand into your local repository Run command git status to ensure that nothing is uncommited and the local and remote branch are at the latest stand the output should be something like: Your branch is up to date with 'origin/wikiMaster'. if not: stop further processing and first commit changes, rebase, ... Run command Git pull --ff-only to get the latest stand in your worktreee

wiki/Overview.html.keywords: Overview and Introduction for Bvms.UiAutomation Good to know some intrersting knowledge about the parts of the project DevTree describes the projects of the Visual Studio solution Architecture details about some internals and architectural basics Patterns Overview about typical used patterns Documentation How the documentation is to handle and manage.

wiki/DevTree.html.title: Developer Tree | BVMS UI Automation
wiki/DevTree.html.keywords: Developer Tree Folders at highest level Folder | what s in & Intention ------------------------|---------------------- .paket | artifacts of our dependency management toolset named [**Paket**](https://fsprojects.github.io/Paket/) cfg | configuration items data | sample data and data sets to play around (in case the data are importand, consider to move to cfg ) [ doc ](#Documentation) | documentation for the project, please read the section [Documentation](#Documentation) packages | extracted packages and tempory artifacts from **Paket** (not included into repository) paket-files | tempory artifacts from **Paket** (not included into repository) [ src`](#Solution) | the source or solution tree containing the source code Solution The src -folder (aka solution tree) is the developer`s main part of the project. It consists of these projects: DomainModel Contains the (UI-)Domain classes of the Configuration Client Utils Contains some helper classes and extensions. Utils.Tests Unit tests to test the helper classes and extensions. ConfigClient.Sdk This project could be treated as an internal SDK for test developers to interact with UI elements (abstracts the UI). ConfigClient.Sdk.Tests Unit tests for ConfigClient.Sdk ConfigClient.Api API for high level interaction with the Config Client to address use cases. ConfigClient.Api.Tests Unit tests to test the API correctness as well as the entry point for automatic Use Case tests in the context of complete workflows driving the API ConfigClient.ExcelAdapter The ExcelAdapter is the bridge to configure the Config Client via an Excel sheet. ConfigClient.ConsoleApp The runner to instantiate the ExcelAdapter . AutomationElements Contains enhanced or new UI AutomationElements compared to the FlaUI project, for instance the Spinner control. The disctinction beween the SDK and the API is the level of abstraction. SDK abstracts the UI, API abstracts an use case. To add a device it is one call in the API ( Add Device ) but it needs different steps of the UI which are triggered via the SDK ( Activate Device Pane , Select the device type in tree , setup the device properties ). Documentation see also Documentation The doc -folder contains the project`s documentation. This documentation is built upon a Git sub-module to reference the project Wiki (sub-folder wiki ) artifacts to configure the DocFX documentation system and temporary output from it (sub-folders sdk , api sdk-api ) a Git sub-module with the static web-sites for the hosting platform (sub-folder _site )
